title: Barriers to Listening
content: Listening barriers include environmental noise, preconceptions, emotional reactions, fatigue, and information overload. Effective listeners identify their personal barriers and actively compensate. If you know you tune out when tired, you work harder to focus during long shifts. Self-awareness enables better listening.

mcq.question: You have a history of conflict with a colleague. They're giving you operational information. What's the listening risk?

options.B: Your preconceptions about them may filter what you hear

mcq.explanation: Past conflict creates unconscious filters. You may dismiss valid information or interpret neutral messages negatively. Awareness of this bias is the first step to countering it.
